 I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָן‎</span> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Num.11.9|Num 11:9]]</sup> ==manna== (= Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, known to Bedouin in Sinai Peninsula; a juice exuding in heavy drops from twigs (some say also the leaves) of <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***ˆarfa*** (ˆªrfa)</u></abbr> tree ***(tamarix gallica mannifera)*** in West Sinai Peninsula, end of May and in June, sweet, sticky, honey-like; compare [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>[[Exod.16.36|Exod 16:36]]</sup> [[BDB#Rob|Rob]]<sup>BRi. 75, 115, 590</sup> [[BDB#Eb|Eb]]<sup>GS 233 ff., 574 ff.</sup> [[BDB#So|Soc]]<sup>ZMG xxxiv. 1881, 254</sup>); — <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> absolute [[Exod.16.15|Exod 16:15]] + 12 t., suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַנֵךָ‎</span> [[Neh.9.20|Neh 9:20]]: — manna: <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיּאֹמְרוּ מָן הוּא כִּי לֹא יָָֽדְעוּ מַההֿוּא‎</span> [[Exod.16.15|Exod 16:15]] v[[Exod.16.31|Exod 16:31]] v[[Exod.16.33|Exod 16:33]] v[[Exod.16.35|Exod 16:35]] v[[Exod.16.35|Exod 16:35]]; [[Num.11.6|Num 11:6]]; [[Num.11.7|Num 11:7]]; [[Num.11.9|Num 11:9]] (described [[Exod.16.14|Exod 16:14]]; [[Exod.16.31|Exod 16:31]]; [[Num.11.7|Num 11:7]] accompare dew [[Exod.16.14|Exod 16:14]]; [[Num.11.9|Num 11:9]]); ceased after Israel reached Canaan [[Josh.5.12|Josh 5:12]] (twice in verse); as 2nd accusative<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶאֱכִילְךָ אֶתהַֿמָּן‎</span> [[Deut.8.3|Deut 8:3]], compare v[[Deut.8.16|Deut 8:16]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָן לֶאֱכֹל וַיַּמְטֵר עֲלֵיהֶם‎</span> [[Ps.78.24|Ps 78:24]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּמַנְךָ לֹאמָֿנַעְתָּ מִפִּיהֶם‎</span> [[Neh.9.20|Neh 9:20]]. 

 II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָן‎</span> in [[Exod.16.15|Exod 16:15]] (with reference to the manna) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַההֿוּא וַיּאֹמְרוּ אִישׁ אֶלאָֿחִיו מָן הוּא כִּי לֹא יָָֽדְעוּ‎</span>, most probably 'What is it?' the question being intended as a popular etymology of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָן‎</span> 'manna,' based upon the ***late*** Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***What ?*** (man is 'Who?' in Arabic, Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מַן‎</span> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">), Mandaean (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מאן‎</span>), Ethiopic (<abbr title="transliteration"><u>***manu***</u></abbr>), 'What?' in these dialects being <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָה‎</span> <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָא‎</span> (Ethiopic <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***ment***</u></abbr>); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָן‎</span> in the sense of 'What?' must correspond to the later Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> contracted from <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָדֵין‎</span> [[BDB#Nö|Nö]]<sup>§ 68</sup> [[BDB#W|W]]<sup>SG 125</sup>).
